custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as a Club

Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Lookups
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to Utilites / Ebis link
custom_expected:
THEN

* Many of the other feeds (player profile, contracts, etc.) contain IDs/codes, so the feed users will need to be able to lookup those codes to find more information about what they stand for.  For example, Org ID 21 is NYY/New York Yankees.
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info for all records modified/added within a given date range
* Club user must be able to retrieve lookup info by passing in ID (e.g. Org ID, Club ID, etc.)
* Club user must be able to determine if any lookup records were physically deleted from a table
*Level of Play Lookup is returned and matches the currently stored values per the requirement. 
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a club, I want information returned for a Recall transaction
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+Recall
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Transactions+-+General+Characteristics

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given player ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for a given transaction ID
* Club user must be able to retrieve transaction details for all transactions modified/added within a given date range
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Only information for Approved or Reversed transactions should be included in the API
* Since this is a MJ transaction, the transactions should only be available via the feed once they have appeared on a transaction bulletin that has been sent to the Clubs (see General Characteristics wiki for examples).
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the UI for the transaction.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a club, I want information returned for the Level of Play Lookup
custom_steps:
Rules:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Requirements%3A+Lookups

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Many of the other feeds (player profile, contracts, etc.) contain IDs/codes, so the feed users will need to be able to lookup those codes to find more information about what they stand for.  For example, Org ID 21 is NYY/New York Yankees.

* Country Lookup is returned and matches the currently stored values per the requirement. 
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information

title: As a MLPA User, I want Waiver Result data returned through an API
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is logged in as test_mlbpa_link@mlb.com / h.f)MrO9bf8H*S6f}2v

https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=EBIS&title=EBIS+2.5+Testing+accounts

custom_steps:
WHEN the user navigates directly to

https://ebisqa.mlb.com/ebisui/#/utilities/rest-client

by manually entering the URL (replace the "ebisqa" with "ebisdev," "ebisstg" etc. when testing in different environments)

Notes: jbancamper [11:02 AM]
so this endpoint returns the previous 9 days of Waiver Request bulletins
starting from Friday return the previous 9 days
if its not a Friday it will go to last week Friday and return the days
so what you have to do
run a Waiver Request Bulletin in DEV? today and tmrw you should see it in the endpoint

Go Into Waivers Menu in the env. you are testing
Find a date or dates no more than 9 days before current date that has data and click the Send Notification button
If there are no days with data on the Waivers page, then you can add data by:
1. selecting a date (no more than 9 days before)
2. Select and Org
3. Click Edit button
4. Add 1 player at a time and select a different Type for each player (max 3 players so you cover each type)

The next day you should see results when you run this MLBPA query
custom_expected:
THEN

* There are no parameters for the user to enter
* Fields listed on the linked wiki should be added to the API
* The API will be updated once a week: Friday at 4pm
* The API will only include data for 9 days (Friday + 8 prior days)
* Fields NOT listed, or fields listed as specifically being excluded should not be added to the API
* Data in the response must exactly match data on the in the Waiver Bulletin reports for the same time period.
* Response should be returned under 2 seconds
* Only logged in users with an API role can access this information
